alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 3:59PM PDT until August 08 at 7:30PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 359 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, Julian, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Mount Laguna, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, Valley Center, I-8 Between Boulevard And Imperial County Line, Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy 79 Between Julian And Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy S1 Between Lake Cuyamaca And Mount Laguna, Descanso, Pine Valley, Hwy 78 Between Ramona And Santa Ysabel, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78, San Diego Country Estates, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Ranchita, Hwy 79 Between Santa Ysabel And Warner Springs and Lake Henshaw. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
